CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 13, 1962, pg. 7 reads: "Carver Week Principals - Main speakers for the George Washington Carver luncheon, held at Hotel Webster Hall, in Pittsburgh, pose with Mrs. Alma Illery (right), founder of the national observance. The visitors are Dr. Lorraine Williams (left), professor of social science at Howard University, and Mrs. G. Mennen Williams, a national leader and wife of the Assistant Secretary of State for African Affairs. - Harris Photo.'
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, from left: Dr. Lorraine Williams, Mrs. G. Mennen Williams, and Alma Illery, posed in Webster Hall during eighteenth annual Washington Carver luncheon
